poem:
**A Shifting Stance**

In the harbors of change,  
a lone vessel parts—  
once bound by blue tides,  
now seeking new shores.

Offord, voyaging—  
his course realigned.  
A peer, a reform,  
a shadow unwinds.

The echo of footsteps,  
untethered from past,  
embracing a promise,  
how long will it last?
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Reform UK gains its first peer after Conservative party defection Reform UK has gained its first peer after a defection a from the Conservative party. Malcolm Offord was unveiled as Reform UK’s latest recruit by party leader Nigel Farage during a rally in Falkirk on Saturday. The businessman served as a Scotland Office minister under the last government and until recently was treasurer of the Scottish Conservatives. Offord confirmed his intentions to stand for Reform". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Reform UK gains its first peer after Conservative party defection Reform UK has gained its first peer after a defection a from the Conservative party.
